doc.after: Hot air balloons had been used with military purposes in Spain as far back as 1896. In 1905, with the help of Alfredo KindelÃ¡n, Leonardo Torres y Quevedo directed the construction of the first Spanish dirigible in the Army Military Aerostatics Service, created in 1896 and located in Guadalajara. The new airship was completed successfully and, named 'EspaÃ±a', made numerous test and exhibition flights.
